author: Robert C. Martin
review: One of the best books for learning how to write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.

author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
review: A classic book that provides practical advice for programmers of all levels.

author: Kyle Simpson
review: An in-depth series that dives deep into JavaScript, covering concepts often misunderstood by developers.

bookName: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
review: Known as the 'Gang of Four' book, it introduces essential design patterns in software engineering.

author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
review: A comprehensive guide to algorithms, often referred to as the 'CLRS book'.

author: Douglas Crockford
review: A concise book highlighting the best features of JavaScript and how to use them effectively.

bookName: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
author: Harold Abelson, Gerald Jay Sussman, Julie Sussman
review: A foundational book in computer science, focusing on abstraction and programming principles.

author: Steve McConnell
review: A widely recommended guide to software construction and coding practices.

bookName: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
author: Martin Fowler
review: A must-read book that teaches how to improve and refactor existing codebases effectively.
